items.title: Woman found dead in Montreal West home during power outage
items.summary_auto: A 66-year-old woman was found dead inside her home on Hudson Avenue in Montreal West on Sunday. Montreal firefighters were performing wellness checks in the area due to power outages, and discovered the woman unconscious at around 6 p.m.

items.title: Military helicopters to be seen over B.C., Alberta, Yukon as part of Canada-U.S. training exercise
items.summary_auto: Exercise STRIKING BAT also sees Canadian forces working alongside Norway, Italy and Mongolia.

items.title: At least 18 dead, hundreds rescued after ferry sinks in Philippines
items.summary_auto: A ferry with more than 350 people on board sank early Monday near an island in the southern Philippines, killing at least 18 people, officials said. Rescuers saved hundreds more, while a fleet of coast guard and naval ships searched for those still missing.

items.title: Private jet crashes in flames at Maine airport with 8 aboard
items.summary_auto: A private aircraft carrying eight people crashed on takeoff Sunday night at Maine's Bangor International Airport, the Federal Aviation Administration said.

items.title: Stephen Miller: ICE’s ideologue-in-chief
items.summary_auto: Top White House advisor Stephen Miller has been called the driving force behind Donald Trump’s domestic agenda – including the aggressive ICE escalation in Minneapolis. We’ve got a deep look at his life and beliefs.

items.title: N.W.T. government won't administer federal gun buyback program
items.summary_auto: For some N.W.T. residents, participating in the federal gun buyback program might not be so straightforward. The Government of the Northwest Territories says it’s not going to administer it.

items.title: 'He deserves to be heard': Mother fights for non-verbal son to use preferred communication method at school
items.summary_auto: Jude Valant, a 19-year-old non-verbal student with severe autism, relies on a communication method called Rapid Prompting Method to express his thoughts. His school won’t allow its use because it is not a recognized form of communication.

items.title: Radon gas may be giving more Canadians lung cancer. Scientists are racing to save lives
items.summary_auto: Radon gas, an invisible health threat that can build up in your home, is putting more Canadians at risk of deadly lung cancer. A national research team is using throwaway toenail clippings to find markers of high radon exposure, in the hope of expanding cancer screenings to save lives.

items.title: Activist warns of ‘propaganda’ as CSIS officials tout agency’s new approach to Indigenous people
items.summary_auto: Officials at the Canadian Security Intelligence Service say the organization is mending its ways and acknowledging past investigating of Indigenous people has left a legacy of mistrust that persists today. One activist, however, is dismissing the overtures as propaganda.

items.title: Disabled man feels shut out of accessible seating as venues — including Rogers Arena — fail to stop abuse
items.summary_auto: With no requirement to prove eligibility, accessible seats at major sports and entertainment venues across the country are sold on the honour system — sometimes leaving people who rely on wheelchairs and other mobility aids unable to get tickets.

items.title: #TheMoment a man climbed a skyscraper without safety gear
items.summary_auto: Mother Dierdre Wolownick and climbing instructor Pete Whittaker tell The National about the moment they watched Alex Honnold climb one of the world's tallest skyscrapers without safety gear in Taipei City, Taiwan — while it was streaming live.

items.title: Kelowna, B.C., sentencing halted after court learns accused overdosed during lunch break
items.summary_auto: The sentencing hearing for a Kelowna woman who killed her boyfriend with a vehicle in 2022 came to an abrupt halt on Friday, after the court heard the accused had been hospitalized.

items.title: N.L. Hydro lifts power warning, power watch in place
items.summary_auto: The power warning for residents across the island of Newfoundland is now lifted, according to a press release by Newfoundland and Labrador Hydro.

items.title: Some Winnipeggers relying on bus shelters, constant movement to stay warm amid extreme cold weather
items.summary_auto: Some Winnipeggers who don't have the option to stay inside during an extreme cold snap say they're worried about their safety as they rely on warming spaces, bus shelters and just keeping their bodies moving to stay warm.

items.title: NBA players association voices support for Minnesota protesters
items.summary_auto: The National Basketball Players Association voiced support on Sunday for protesters in Minneapolis, rallying against the deadly presence of U.S. federal immigration authorities.

items.title: B.C. tourism agencies face off for a piece of Heated Rivalry star Hudson Williams
items.summary_auto: Hudson Williams, who stars as Shane Hollander in the Crave series, has connections to Vancouver, Kelowna, Kamloops and New Westminster. The cities' tourism bureaus are now leaning in to the success of the series with in a tongue-in-cheek competition on social media to claim the actor as their own.

items.title: How Minnesota's history of protest informs this moment
items.summary_auto: Minnesota has a robust history of protest going back to the 1890s, and the pivotal moments the twin cities played in labour and civil rights movements.
